intro: Acinodendron glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, glandular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The species is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
